 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ENOUGH TIME
TIMEOUTS(LEVEL AAA)
On accessible websites...

Users are warned of the duration of any user inactivity that could cause data
loss, unless the data is preserved for more than 20 hours when the user does not
take any actions.

These websites...

Provide users enough time to read and use content.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
While making a purchase on an e-commerce Web site, the information input by the
user is stored for more than 20 hours. This helps ensure that if they need to
stop working for a while that they are more likely to be able to continue the
purchase when they return. I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/timeouts.html#examples] Web Content
Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium Recommendation 27
February 2020 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2020/WD-WCAG22-20200227/, Latest version at
https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
